attachments.title: Germany's vaccine regulator reports 31 cases of blood disorder after AstraZeneca shot
attachments.text: Germany's vaccine regulator said on Tuesday it has recorded 31 cases of a rare blood clot in the brain, nine of which resulted in deaths, after people received a COVID-19 vaccine from AstraZeneca.
attachments.fallback: U.S.: Germany's vaccine regulator reports 31 cases of blood disorder after AstraZeneca shot

text:
This article doesn't mention it: the permanent vaccine commission now only recommends it for use on people older than 60, and at least two states have stopped use on younger people already.

(<https://www.dw.com/en/german-vaccine-commission-recommends-astrazeneca-for-over-60s-only/a-57049301> has some more info)

text:
This is not exactly good for people's trust in the vaccine:

> "At some point with AstraZeneca specifically we might have to operate with a lot of freedom: whoever wants to and whoever dares to, so to speak, should have the opportunity," Söder said. "With AstraZeneca it seems some new problem or other should be expected daily. And honestly you sense that in the broader public perception as well."
